programme.title: Hard Knocks: The Dallas Cowboys
programme.desc: Quarterback Dak Prescott makes significant progress with his injury rehab; an inter-squad practice against the Rams leads to tension with Rams' superstar Aaron Donald; the Cowboys end their time in Oxnard, Calif., with a trip to Arizona.

programme.title: Hard Knocks: The Dallas Cowboys
programme.desc: Veteran players like Dak Prescott, Ezekiel Elliott and Amari Cooper prepare to face Tom Brady and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in Thursday's NFL Kickoff game; players on the bubble find out their fate.

programme.title: Hard Knocks: The Dallas Cowboys
programme.desc: The Texas heat is brutal as both the oppressive weather and impending roster cuts create tension on the practice field; the players get an opportunity to bond at a backyard barbeque hosted by rookie LB Micah Parsons.

programme.title: Hard Knocks: The Dallas Cowboys
programme.desc: After three weeks in California, Dak Prescott, Ezekiel Elliott and the Cowboys return to the comforts of home; their homecoming brings a visit from the cross-state Texans for preseason game No. 3.

programme.title: Hard Knocks: Training Camp With the Houston Texans

programme.desc: Jadeveon Clowney returns to the field after a long recovery from surgery; the Denver Broncos visit NRG Stadium for the Texans' second preseason game.

programme.title: Hard Knocks: Training Camp With the Houston Texans
programme.desc: The Texans begin reducing the roster in preparation for getting down to 53 players by opening day; the team travels to New Orleans to play the Saints in a preseason game.

programme.title: Warren Miller's Playground
programme.desc: The world is our playground and nobody knows that better than the skiers and riders in Warren Miller’s Playground. Join pioneers like Gretchen Bleiler, Bode Miller, Andreas Hatveit, Mathias Roten, Ueli Kestenholz, and numerous others as they travel around the world from Chile all the way to the sand dunes of Dubai, up to Sweden and the peaks of the Swiss Alps. This year’s invigorating action display includes: a rare and insightful segment on ski racing king and perceived industry bad boy, Bode Miller; a trip to Alaska’s untouched Chugach Range with X-Games Gold Medalists, and brothers, Zach and Reggie Crist; unbelievably deep powder in Utah and British Columbia; and astonishing aerial acrobatics from Sweden, and so much more. PLAYGROUND also highlights the future of snowboarding in a segment featuring the youth-infused Burton Smalls Team in which these young prodigies teach us that size truly isn’t everything.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty begins the process of taking out plants which are in the wrong place and either moving or dividing others. He also gives advice on making leaf mould from fallen leaves and how to use it.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty adds flowers for pollinators to his wildlife garden, creates an alpine trough and plants out tender veg in his vegetable garden. Adam Frost uses the wonders of technology when comedian Susan Calman contacts him for advice with her garden in Glasgow.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on plants to use for foliage with tropical proportions, Arit Anderson continues investigating the use of peat and Carol Klein explores Oxford Botanic Garden's euphorbias.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Arit Anderson and Frances Tophill visit Wakehurst, Kew's wild botanic garden in Sussex. They not only explore the gardens but also meet the gardeners, joining in on their planting projects and finding out more about the UK's largest conservation project, the Millenium Seed Bank.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty turns his attention to containers, planting them up for drama and summer colour in the jewel garden and showing us how to repot citrus plants. In Hampshire, Joe Swift meets the designer of an award-winning contemporary garden to explore the techniques and the plants she has used to seamlessly integrate both house and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As midsummer approaches, it's the perfect time for Monty to place succulents outside at Longmeadow, as well as planting out dahlias and tender vegetables. Carol Klein visits Trebah Garden in Cornwall, where she finds plants which can add early summer pazazz to our borders. Nick Bailey is at RHS Wisley to look at a variety of shrubs that can be used as alternatives to traditional box hedging. We travel to the seaside in Kent to meet a group of gardeners who have transformed a public space.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plans for next year's fruit harvest when he adds gooseberries to the fruit garden he planted earlier in the year. He also divides and moves herbaceous perennials and advises on the best bulbs to plant now for cut flowers next year. Frances Tophill meets a couple who have filled their garden with tender plants and devised a meticulous method of protecting them over the winter.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: July is a great time to get out and about visiting gardens, and this week, Monty Don travels to Cambridge for an exclusive tour of the gorgeous garden at Clare College. He'll also be catching up with various tasks at Longmeadow and, with luck, will be harvesting his first tomatoes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don demonstrates how to prepare for spring and summer with timely tasks in his damp garden and around the pond, and Joe Swift continues his series of master classes on planting design by sharing tips on how to create a tropical green oasis. Elsewhere, Carol Klein plants a viburnum that will give spring colour and fill her Devon garden with fragrance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Longmeadow is in full bloom, but Monty Don is keen to remind viewers that there is still time to sow some late vegetables, demonstrating how easy it is to grow salad in a pot. It's time to give wisterias their summer prune. An expert, whose 252ft vine was in full flower just weeks ago, shows how she cuts back that summer growth. Meanwhile, Carol Klein has been out and about in Norfolk to revel in the bearded iris.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As plants begin to show their early growth, Monty gets plenty of plants for free when he demonstrates how to make the most of herbaceous perennials. He also cuts back pelargoniums that have overwintered in the greenhouse and makes a start on sowing vegetables. Nick Bailey shares plans for his new garden in Northamptonshire and shows how to create a container garden ideal for those on the move. Frances Tophill discovers more ways to use cut flowers as she visits a florist in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before, loofahs. He also celebrates some of his favourite tulip combinations and plants out crocosmia. Joe Swift visits a garden, created by an award-winning designer.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don visits two sets of ambitious gardeners, each facing challenges on a very different scale. One is a tiny urban courtyard in Hackney and the other is a outdoor area for a community.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the Wimbledon tennis championships just around the corner, Joe Swift meets the gardening team responsible for the spectacular floral displays at this world-renowned event.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don makes a start on his new wild flower garden at Longmeadow and at last gets to taste the first new potatoes of the year. He also demonstrates how a radical chop of some border plants now can rejuvenate them for later in the season. Carol Klein celebrates a cottage garden favourite, the foxglove, and Joe Swift drops in on world renowned garden designer, Dan Pearson.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty's focus is on summer when he plants up containers for colour in the Jewel Garden. He also turns his attention to overcrowded ornamental grasses which, now they are beginning to put on growth, need to be split and replanted. Continuing her search for finding the right plant for the right place, Carol takes a close look at why plants survive in the cracks and crevices of walls and gives her recommendations for garden plants that will thrive in similar conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Join Adam Frost in his garden, where he will be giving tips on laying turf, planting succulents and adding perennial plants to his kitchen garden to grow as cut flowers. Joe Swift travels to Marwood Hill Gardens in Devon to explore plants that thrive in moist conditions.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Mason Baker to sample some early morning Islamorada backcountry baby tarpon action.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: After a successful morning of baby tarpon fishing, Captains Tom Rowland, Rich Tudor and Mason Baker slide over to the legendary downtown Islamorada flats to check on the resurgence of Florida Keys bonefish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head into the Everglades backcountry out of Key Largo to fish the shallow grass flats for tailing redfish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Saltwater Experience Charters’ Captain Garrett Stephens for a trip into the Gulf. When their catches get repeatedly cut off, they decide to bring the massive bull sharks up to the surface for a closer look.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss heads offshore with Capt. Will Osborne out of Cortez, Florida, in search of Hogfish and other bottom dwellers!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali & Rush look back on the adventures of the year and revisit the concept behind Local Knowledge.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The Flylords team heads to Wyoming for an unforgettable adventure. Join them as they explore incredible fly-fishing opportunities and learn about the passionate folks behind Two Rivers Fishing Co. and Worldcast Anglers. Along the way, they share stories, fish some of Wyoming's best waters, and meet the dedicated guides who call this place home. The team also participates in a special event at Roadhouse Brewing Co., raising money for Jackson Hole Trout Unlimited to help conserve and protect local trout populations.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: In this episode we explore the wrecks and reefs that make Marathon one of the top dive destinations in the world. We will highlight what being done buy groups to restore our fragile coral reefs.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway; cruising the almighty Seine River through France, from Paris up to the battlefields of WWI. Enjoying the food and wine of the area, while learning about the history and experiencing the culture of this glorious region.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway David Reyne is in France, cruising the Seine River, visiting the somber sites of the D-Day Landings plus the spectacular gardens that inspired Monet.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson set off to hunt the American Alligator in eastern Texas. A species that was placed on the endangered species list in the 1960s, their populations are now thriving. Kyle and Jeff have agreed to help remove some problem gators off private land owned by their friend Troy, but things get rowdy when Kyle loses a bet and has to swim with the very gators he is hunting.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: No, we aren’t talking about a hair dew. Danny hangs out with some amazing people that commercial fish for Florida gold.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: The Kenai River Sportfishing Association (KRSA) was founded 30 years ago by Bob Penney with a strong and clear mission: sustain the local King salmon population in order to preserve the Kenai’s status as the greatest sportfishing river in the world. Over the years the organization has grown, developing numerous conservation and sustainability projects to support the health of this one-of-a-kind waterway – several of which are explored in the film.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: For more than 30 years, the Friends of the Fox River (FOTFR) organization has been working to protect and restore the Fox River in Illinois and Wisconsin. Now led by Gary Swick and Jenni Kempf, FOTFR is still fighting for the Fox, organizing river cleanup events to remove tons of trash from the river basin and educating students by bringing them directly to the watershed.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: Host Ryan McVinney takes Boat Trader fans on an indepth exploration of Florida flats fishing deep in the backcountry of Islamorada. Featuring Captain Eric Lund, a Wall Street Broker turned backcountry fishing guide, this episode reveals the key design features of the world’s best flats skiffs and how they are built for targeting some of the most exciting sportfish species on the planet. Also, covered are bay boats and their versatility for families exploring Florida’s coastal waterways, along with a detailed study of fish species and wildlife in the region. Some of the area’s most beautiful and secret locales show why Islamorada has earned the nickname of the Sportfish Capital of The World.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson closes out the half way point on the South America Waterfowl Slam. On just the third day of the hunt, he is able to take a Chilean Wigeon and a Rosy Billed Pochard which make species number 9 and 10 of the 20 on his list. Mark is still sharing the blind with Matt Gindorff, a WTA consultant, and they discuss waterfowl hunting in Argentina and how it compares to that of the U.S.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and George from Two Georges Marina battle the wind and tide on a tough day of fishing which leads Josh to fish another day, solely for revenge on the Sheepshead!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Texas is the home to many exotic species that can be hunted. One species in particular, Axis, have a very large population. Our team got together and had a great time hanging out with a land owner and hunting Axis deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed today to hunt with Cole Dutton for the Inaugural Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. We are honored to spend a weekend with Cole and his family at the G2 Ranch. Disabled Outdoorsman has played a huge part in getting those less fortunate outdoors. We are truly blessed to be able to follow along and capture these great moments.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Over the years we have been able to hunt with a lot of amazing people. This episode takes us to Las Palmas ranch to hunt with Payton Angelle. Payton was awarded this hunt from the amazing people over at Sky High for kids.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week we are rolling along side the crew from Double T Outfitters. Management plays a huge role in every outfitters success every year. Bret and his team have a strong management plan in place and these guys had a blast with a group of out of state hunters.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: For DIRT’s first trip across the pond, host Josh Rosen dove head first into Ireland. From long-held traditions to the modern-day artisanal movement, he unearthed the multicultural goldmine between the highlands and the Wild Atlantic Way—with stops for surfing, a seaweed bath, and a couple holes of golf spectated by free-range goats, of course. Foraged cocktails? Fresh crabs from Galway Bay? It’s all on the table in this episode rooted in community, homegrown ingredients, and the damn good people who bring it all together. Subscribe to our YouTube channel to catch up on all of DIRT’s past adventures.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Episode one hits close to home. Specifically, Josh’s hometown of Seattle where we travel from the mountains to the coast in pursuit of local ingredients for an authentic Washington meal. Digging for forest delicacies, hunting for exotic bivalves, and exploring the tidal flats of a multi-generational shellfish farm—it’s all on the menu.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate – outside – in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: On opening day of Missouri’s gun season, hunters from around the state seek ridges and box blinds throughout the “Show Me” state in search of mature whitetail bucks. For Nikki Boxler and the Winchester Deer Camp, it’s no different. With Winchester’s in hand, Nikki and crew play cat and mouse with several mature bucks at Indian Hill Outfitters in Pike County.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every season, just like clockwork, mission-driven longboards gobble their way across the plains of South Dakota, the cornfields of Iowa, the timbered ridges of Michigan and the cattle ground of Kansas looking for their soulmates in one of the most celebrated hunting seasons in America…the wild turkey breeding season. Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at John’s lake house on Tupper Lake, NY, where they are tackling a new paint Job using Interlux’s paint specifically designed for aluminum hulls. John and the crew take us step by step on what takes to paint on aluminum hulls as well as some other tips from guest hosts.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is taking the Marine Surplus Console for the Aqua sport project and giving it a much needed face lift. They meet the team at Boat Outfitters to find an acrylic covering board to fit the console and cover the pre existing holes. They then head over to meet with crew at AwlGrip to get some ideas on color matching the console with the Aqua sport.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has Slade’s brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on let’s see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are super busy juggling the turkey season opener, but we also have our real estate convention in Gulf Shores Alabama, multiple listing videos to complete, and property showings. It happens every year to us, spring kicks off and people want to have properties of their own knowing dog gone well it’s the most wonderful time of the year. TURKEY SEASON! It’s a jam up of a week. You’re not going to want to miss it.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When the Bay Point Billfish Open returns, we hop on board the Ellie B for some offshore competition and follow the event’s epic dockside party.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin & Meredith’s beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesn’t come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After several years of shifting focus back to his native whitetails, Dahlke returns to mule deer country with the Muley Freak, Erik Van Woerkom. Follow along on this Utah mule deer hunt.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: For decades, Paul Butski has set the standard in turkey calling. His name is etched into the NWTF Grand National Calling Championships Hall of Fame, and his influence stretches far beyond the stage. He didn’t just win competitions, he shaped the way we talk to turkeys – and more importantly, the way we hunt them.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: On this weeks episode of Hunting Land Man, Slade and his daughter Asa take on the turkey woods together for the first time. As this is Asa's first time turkey hunting some quick pre hunt preparations are in order. Slade also was able to sit down with a good friend and registered forester to talk fire and the benefits of fire in land management. The next day, Asa and Slade were able to connect with a thundering tom as Asa punched her first ever turkey tag!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade goes over what he’s doing at his home property to create summer food plots for deer, and gives tips to those looking to do the same. On the final hunt for the 2024 season, Lori gets a big Wilkinson County gobbler.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his son take on the turkey woods for an afternoon hunt. Although the woods remained quiet, a tom soon snuck out of the woods and on the end of Bentley's barrel! After that Slade was able to help a client of his harvest his first turkey! And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting are taking turns filming and hunting Mule Deer in Colorado where they both harvest big mature Colorado bucks with Browning 6.8 Westerns at long range. They leave Colorado and go to Nebraska to hunt with Heritage Outfitters and double up on two great spots and stalk bucks.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting team up with a crew from Simmons Sporting Goods and head west to chase the Wild Turkey! Good times, Good Friends and Great Hunting make for an awesome Spring hunting trip.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield of All Things Hunting and Willi Schmidt of Pure Hunting share their personal stories of how hunting has been an integral part of their lives, passed down through generations. While their beginnings and experiences are very different, they find common ground in the heritage of Browning Firearms with memorable whitetail hunts in Louisiana and Montana.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a trip out to God's Grocery Store with country star Styles Haury ashe and Brandon look for Tuna and Snapper to bring home to the family.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons is passionate about catching the mighty Sailfish, andgoes out with his tournament partner and former MLB star, Doug Mankietwicz. Doug has won a World Series and Olympic Gold medal, and now is in search of some Sails.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon takes outdoorsman Zac Yarbrough to look for blackfin tuna and then out deep for swordfish. They are joined by Styles Haury for some epic offshore action.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Renowned Kiteboarder Mike Walsh goes out on a windy day with Brandon to see what they can catch around the iconic lighthouses of the middle Keys.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss travels to Melbourne, on Florida’s Space Coast, to cast flies with Capt. Noah Miler at some unforgettable fish.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Lifelong cowboy and Oklahoma native Bill Parker is believed to be the 1st man to reach the shores of Normandy on D-day…June 6th 1944.
Tarif Alkhatib hunts a couple giant whitetails in his home state of Texas!

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Notoriously nocturnal and living in some of the densest cover imaginable, the black-tailed deer is generally known to be more ghostly than the most challenging old whitetails.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: In the wide world of western big game, pronghorn antelope hunting in Wyoming is unmatched in its accessibility and excitement. It’s an active pursuit, typically ripe with plenty of opportunities to spot and stalk black-horned bucks. This makes it an ideal forum for riflemen looking to scratch their western itch.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Mason Baker to sample some early morning Islamorada backcountry baby tarpon action.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: After a successful morning of baby tarpon fishing, Captains Tom Rowland, Rich Tudor and Mason Baker slide over to the legendary downtown Islamorada flats to check on the resurgence of Florida Keys bonefish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head into the Everglades backcountry out of Key Largo to fish the shallow grass flats for tailing redfish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Saltwater Experience Charters’ Captain Garrett Stephens for a trip into the Gulf. When their catches get repeatedly cut off, they decide to bring the massive bull sharks up to the surface for a closer look.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss heads offshore with Capt. Will Osborne out of Cortez, Florida, in search of Hogfish and other bottom dwellers!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali & Rush look back on the adventures of the year and revisit the concept behind Local Knowledge.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The Flylords team heads to Wyoming for an unforgettable adventure. Join them as they explore incredible fly-fishing opportunities and learn about the passionate folks behind Two Rivers Fishing Co. and Worldcast Anglers. Along the way, they share stories, fish some of Wyoming's best waters, and meet the dedicated guides who call this place home. The team also participates in a special event at Roadhouse Brewing Co., raising money for Jackson Hole Trout Unlimited to help conserve and protect local trout populations.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: In this episode we explore the wrecks and reefs that make Marathon one of the top dive destinations in the world. We will highlight what being done buy groups to restore our fragile coral reefs.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway; cruising the almighty Seine River through France, from Paris up to the battlefields of WWI. Enjoying the food and wine of the area, while learning about the history and experiencing the culture of this glorious region.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway David Reyne is in France, cruising the Seine River, visiting the somber sites of the D-Day Landings plus the spectacular gardens that inspired Monet.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson set off to hunt the American Alligator in eastern Texas. A species that was placed on the endangered species list in the 1960s, their populations are now thriving. Kyle and Jeff have agreed to help remove some problem gators off private land owned by their friend Troy, but things get rowdy when Kyle loses a bet and has to swim with the very gators he is hunting.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: No, we aren’t talking about a hair dew. Danny hangs out with some amazing people that commercial fish for Florida gold.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: The Kenai River Sportfishing Association (KRSA) was founded 30 years ago by Bob Penney with a strong and clear mission: sustain the local King salmon population in order to preserve the Kenai’s status as the greatest sportfishing river in the world. Over the years the organization has grown, developing numerous conservation and sustainability projects to support the health of this one-of-a-kind waterway – several of which are explored in the film.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: For more than 30 years, the Friends of the Fox River (FOTFR) organization has been working to protect and restore the Fox River in Illinois and Wisconsin. Now led by Gary Swick and Jenni Kempf, FOTFR is still fighting for the Fox, organizing river cleanup events to remove tons of trash from the river basin and educating students by bringing them directly to the watershed.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: Host Ryan McVinney takes Boat Trader fans on an indepth exploration of Florida flats fishing deep in the backcountry of Islamorada. programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his son take on the turkey woods for an afternoon hunt. Although the woods remained quiet, a tom soon snuck out of the woods and on the end of Bentley's barrel! After that Slade was able to help a client of his harvest his first turkey! And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting are taking turns filming and hunting Mule Deer in Colorado where they both harvest big mature Colorado bucks with Browning 6.8 Westerns at long range. They leave Colorado and go to Nebraska to hunt with Heritage Outfitters and double up on two great spots and stalk bucks.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting team up with a crew from Simmons Sporting Goods and head west to chase the Wild Turkey! Good times, Good Friends and Great Hunting make for an awesome Spring hunting trip.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield of All Things Hunting and Willi Schmidt of Pure Hunting share their personal stories of how hunting has been an integral part of their lives, passed down through generations. While their beginnings and experiences are very different, they find common ground in the heritage of Browning Firearms with memorable whitetail hunts in Louisiana and Montana.

He declares his love, and, although Helen insists that her career will always come first, the two get married. Soon, Peter is consumed by jealous suspicions of his wife's male patients and embarrasses Helen several times. Fearful of driving her away, Peter launches into character-changing behavior to prove his love.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: Banjo Hackett

programme.title: The Nebraskan
programme.desc: When his Indian assistant, Wingfoot (Maurice Jara), is accused of murdering a Sioux chief, Army scout Wade Harper (Phil Carey) brings him to Fort Kearney, Neb., where Colonel Markham (Regis Toomey) insists the young man has the right to a fair trial rather than handing him over to the Sioux. While in jail, Wingfoot is forced to escape with ruthless prisoner Reno Benton (Lee Van Cleef). Wade sets out with a small party to rescue his friend, with the Sioux right behind him.

programme.title: The Rough, Tough West

programme.title: California Conquest

Sam, who is respected by Hannah's family, is a noble man who cares for her and can make a good living in their frontier town. Yet Hannah craves adventure and finds it when she meets dashing Ben Dembrow (Larry Parks), the youngest of a notorious crime family. Together Ben and Hannah set off to forge a new life, but prejudice and strangling family ties soon bring trouble to these newlyweds.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual Midsomer Scarecrow Festival takes a grisly turn as bodies begin appearing on poles displayed alongside their straw creations; the investigation reveals rivalries that run deep and shows people will do just about anything to win.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Mummers, an amateur operatic society, rehearses for its charity concert when the body of an unknown man is found in the theatre; the investigation quickly becomes a race to discover who is desperate to take centre stage.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Each year, the village of Angel's Rise hosts the Psychic Fayre. Founded by the Saint-Stephens family in memory of their late daughter, the event attracts mediums, psychics and followers of the occult. When a body is found surrounded by ritual symbols on the eve of the festival, Barnaby must step into the spiritual world to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When DCI Barnaby and DS Troy arrive in the sleepy village of Badger's Drift to investigate the sudden death of elderly Miss Emily Simpson, her next door neighbour insists that she had been murdered, after she had seen her return from a walk in the woods, unnerved and shocked by something she had witnessed. When the post mortem confirms her death was no accident, the pair discover that nothing is what it seems to be within the little village as they try to find out what exactly she saw. Their investigation introduces Barnaby and Troy to many eccentric and quirky residents and soon turns up a web of sex, blackmail and lies, and the possibility that the murder could be connected to a shooting accident two years ago, which claimed another woman's life.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After debating on who their next guest speaker should be, the Midsomer Worthy Writers' Circle decide to invite famous writer, Max Jennings, to their next meeting, despite opposition to the choice by Gerald Hadleigh, the group's chairman. When Hadleigh is found dead the day after Jennings visit, brutally bludgeoned and stripped naked, Barnaby and Troy discover that the victim had many mysteries to him, prompting them to delve into his private life and his past. Matters soon become complicated when Jennings disappears and is later found dead, and a witness recalls seeing a mysterious woman in Hadleigh's house the night before his murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst investigating the murder of Agnes Gray, a quiet animal-loving woman who was bludgeoned to death and found floating in a river near to the village of Ferne Basset, Barnaby gets more than he bargained for when he attends his wife's performance in the Causton Amateur Dramatics' production of Amadeus. When Agnes's cousin, Esslyn Carmichael, inadvertently cuts his own throat during the final act, it's quickly discovered that the tape on the prop blade he had used was removed without anyone knowing. The detective is left wondering who had wanted to turn Esslyn's final act into a true coup de theatre, as he and Troy try to determine what the motive was behind the two murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Local villagers in Morton Fendle are up in arms, demanding answers from Alan Hollingsworth, the owner of a local craft centre they had invested in, after news comes out that it has recently fallen into financial turmoil. As tensions begin rising in the village, Barnaby soon suspects that something has happened to Alan's wife, Simone, when his behaviour suddenly changes. His suspicions are soon confirmed when it transpires that Simone was kidnapped, after one of Alan's neighbours is murdered, shortly after witnessing something they shouldn't have.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Bill Carter, one of the founders of a local New Age commune called the Lodge of the Golden Windhorse, dies suddenly after falling down some stairs and breaking his neck. Although there was uncertainty as to whether it was the result of an accident or murder, Barnaby and Troy find themselves having to determine which it was, when Ian Craigie, the commune's leader, is stabbed to death with a carving knife a few days later, while attending a spiritual seance with the rest of the commune and the parents of one of its members. It's not long before they discover hidden truths about the commune's founding and some of its members.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a survivalist is found murdered in his bombproof shelter, Barnaby unravels a dark conspiracy to reveal how far people will go to escape the end of the world.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: The Price of Fame
programme.desc: Known around the world as Princess Leia in the 'Star Wars' franchise, Carrie Fisher was an actress and award-winning writer; Carrie was introduced to drugs at a young age, which marked the beginning of her struggle with addiction.

programme.title: Elizabeth Montgomery: A Bewitched Life
programme.desc: Among the most enduring TV sitcoms of all time, Bewitched remains beloved nearly sixty years after its debut. The series lead, Elizabeth Montgomery, was a complex, strong-willed woman whose life and career became an ongoing quest for love and recognition she never received from her movie star father. Bewitched became one of television's biggest hits during the turbulent 1960s, a time that was symbolic of the series' behind-the-scenes turmoil.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a heat wave envelops West Monroe the air conditioning unit at the Duck Commander warehouse goes down, turning the duck call assembly room into a boiling sweatshop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning. But the discovery of an old Ping-Pong table deep within the clutter quickly turns the chore into an all day table tennis tournament. Meanwhile, Uncle Si realizes that he's many years overdue for an appointment with the local eye doctor and ventures out for some new glasses.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After attending a local radio show as a guest, Willie sees an opportunity to host a show of his own. When the station gives him the opportunity, Willie makes the mistake of bringing Uncle Si on the air with him.

programme.desc: Willie receives a special gift from a Japanese business associate - a "priceless" samurai sword, which Willie keeps out of the hands of Jase and the guys.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie pushes his work force too far after implementing new "motivational work tactics," and the guys rise up against him and go on strike.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When NASCAR sensation Clint Bowyer pays a visit to the Duck Commander warehouse, Willie and the guys are fired up to spend the day hanging out with the professional racecar driver. But too much enthusiasm about the celebrity's mode of transportation turns into a drag race showdown between Willie and Clint. Phil and Si have their hands full fixing Ms. Kay's barbecue when a trip to the outdoor grill store turns disastrous.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's Willie's turn to play Santa Claus at the local church this year but Uncle Si crashes the party and the event goes south in a hurry. Meanwhile, the family gathers at Phil and Miss Kay's house to celebrate the holidays in true redneck fashion.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie finds his office in shambles and alerts the authorities that the warehouse has had a break in. But soon Willie discovers that the culprit was his brother Jase, who needed supplies for an early morning frog hunt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a heat wave envelops West Monroe the air conditioning unit at the Duck Commander warehouse goes down, turning the duck call assembly room into a boiling sweatshop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning. But the discovery of an old Ping-Pong table deep within the clutter quickly turns the chore into an all day table tennis tournament. Meanwhile, Uncle Si realizes that he's many years overdue for an appointment with the local eye doctor and ventures out for some new glasses.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David and Steve try to revive a 1975-ish Dodge pickup whose engine has been rotting outside since Ronald Reagan was president; when the adventure starts, they have no clue if the 360 small block can be saved.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David and Steve had a blast getting an old Dodge 360 running and driving in a gutted old truck; now they want to jerk that engine and transplant it into a '70 Challenger that has been off the road since at least 1989.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David and Steve try to revive a 1967 Jeep J100 panel truck from Rick Pewe's backyard.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: A 1974 Chevy stepside pickup loaded with an LS6 engine gets a mini-makeover in preparation for the 2016 Hot Rod Power Tour.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David and Steve attack a Jeep Scrambler that's been in the Freiburger fleet for about 20 years; they pull it out of hiding, spiff up some mechanical glitches, and head out for some hard-core rock-crawling adventures.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David and Steve build up a cool, vintage body style by adding extra doors to a 1966 Chevelle they picked up for $1,000; it's all about fast and cheap trying to get this muscle car out for some sideways action on a dirt oval.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Crew Cab Chevelle is back for some basic suspension upgrades; once complete, it goes head-to-head on the autocross with Lucky Costa's '66 two-door daily driver, with its LS engine, six-speed transmission and trick suspension.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Crop Duster is a back-to-basics street and strip machine with big-block power; it's running its quickest quarter mile ever, running in the 11s in no-prep track conditions.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: For no good reason, David has always wanted to drive a Pontiac Bonneville to the Bonneville Salt Flats; Steve picks up a 1967 station wagon, and the two are on the road, arriving in Utah to a big surprise.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David wants to make a daily driver out of a '71 Plymouth Road Runner.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys try to hop up the power on David's 1971 Plymouth Road Runner.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The new look for the Crusher is inspired by early 1970s NHRA Modified Production drag cars; the transformation of a BluePrint Engines 400ci small-block Chevy.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David fixes up Steve's never-driven 1973 Dodge 100 to finally get his beloved muscle truck out on the road.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Crusher Camaro gets its eighth engine in its 23rd year as a project car; Steve Dulcich and David Freiburger install the engine along with a TH350 transmission.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich hack the sheet metal off of a 1970 Dodge Challenger to fit giant off-road tires and go desert-bashing.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich gears up and attacks David Freiburger's 1970 Plymouth known as the Crop Duster.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger heads well outside the garage and into the outback of Colorado to revive a '68 Jeep Wagoneer that was untouched for 22 years; he gets help from special guest host Rick Pewe, editor of Jp Magazine.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger's 1967 Chevy, the Crusher Camaro, is one of the industry's best-known project cars; this changeling is getting its latest makeover on Roadkill Garage, and the retro revival wraps up with a trip to the drag strip.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Dulcich D100 is back; after a couple of engines, Steve Dulcich and David Freiburger install a fresh, 550hp, 408ci engine in the Mopar Muscle Truck.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve and David work on fixing an aftermarket fuel injection on a Ford muscle truck.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Cougar and the gear-banging are back, but the car now belongs to Steve Dulcich, and the guys are jerking the haggard Cleveland in favor of a 450hp, 363ci, Windsor-based stroker small-block.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David and Steve have a great time fixing the Crusher Impala and testing it with 100-yard burnouts.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The beloved Crew Cab Chevelle is back and the guys want to find out how fast this old four-door vehicle can go in a standing mile.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich have a new project car, a quick and dirty 1940 Ford Fordor; the guys decide to beef it up with some new heads, a new carb and a supercharger.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger's wild scheme for pick-up truck greatness begins with a grandpa-fresh long bed and a high horsepower engine after he picks up two vintage Chevy C10 pick-up trucks.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger scores a 1968 Chrysler Town and Country wagon for $1,800, and with its 440ci big-block for power, it's soon dubbed the Gargantuwagon; Freiburger and Steve Dulcich show how to give any old car a once-over.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger scores a 1965 Ford F-250 4x4 like one he used to own and comes up with a plan.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich had big dreams for his 1968 Plymouth Barracuda before it burned to the ground in the California wildfires; Dulcich was devastated, and his buddy David Freiburger decided they needed to make the car live again.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich demonstrate how to get big-block power for cheap by choosing a non-mainstream engine.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich and David Freiburger put 650 horsepower from a Ford Cleveland engine in a Jeep Commando, starting the Clevo Commando project.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Ford Muscle Truck; the guys take a break to look at progress on the Disgustang 1969 Mach 1 and wrap with a new-to-them Pro Street FoMoCo project car.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Vanishing Paint 1970 Dodge Challenger gathered dust for months, but now the guys need to fix it in time for a Tire Rack race.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich show how to install a ProCharger centrifugal supercharger on any carbureted V-8; this one happens to be the bone-stock 350ci small-block in the 1967 Chevy C10 shortbed.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich are back with the 1970 Dodge Challenger known as Vanishing Paint; they install a homegrown package of average-guy suspension add-ons for cornering performance.

programme.desc: David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich teach the ins and outs of a nitrous installation.

programme.desc: David and Steve have been challenged to a Jeep build-off.

programme.desc: After their Gremlin spins a bearing, the guys pick up on other projects.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The '67 Chevy C10 shortbed finally becomes a respectable daily driver.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys bring the '70 Dodge "Off-Road Challenger" back to life.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys are finally going give the '69 "Disgustang" the love it deserves.

programme.desc: The guys tackle the Disgustang's needs to make it a daily-driving beast.

programme.desc: After two long years of body work, the '67 C10 Crop Duster is finally done.

programme.desc: Dog tries to nab a fugitive named Wayne by tricking him. Dog calls Wayne to tell him that he's won a new vacuum cleaner and he should stick around to get it.

programme.desc: Dog and the team get a big surprise after they track down Bosco, a fugitive who they believe is addicted to methamphetamines. They discover he's off drugs, settling into a normal life with a new girlfriend, and is very friendly.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's second programme Gordon tackles a pub for the first time, getting to grips with The Fenwick Arms in rural Lancashire. The pub is run by landlord Brian who, after thirty years in the business and a quadruple heart-bypass, still puts in 120 hours a week and insists on laying down the law in the kitchen. Despite their best endeavours Brian and his partner Elaine are ~£250k in debt, losing ~1500 a week and facing bankruptcy within three months unless there's a drastic reversal in their fortunes.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's programme Gordon finds a chef caught in a time warp when he tackles a picturesque but largely unfrequented upmarket restaurant in King's Lynn, a traditional market town on the Norfolk coast. For the last eighteen months ex Michelin-starred chef Nick has owned and run Rococo but his past success is now eluding him. The menu is past its sell-by date, the service is stuffy, the food is over-priced and the only thing being fed is his ego. Yet, despite debts of ~£100k and the prospect of putting his home at risk and his young family on the streets, Nick continues to cook comatose in a 1990s fantasy land of his own making.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits West Dover in Vermont, to try to save a dog-friendly hotel that’s desperately in need of help. Sandy MacDougall, the owner, runs the hotel like a hostel with unpaid staff staying in the rooms instead of paying guests.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to Murphy’s Historic Hotel near Sacramento in northern California, where party-boy owners Brian, Kevin and Joel are too busy drinking, partying and lap-dancing in the rowdy bar, to look after their historic hotel.

programme.title: Tattoo Fixers: Extreme
programme.desc: Pash rids Thomas of a mummy's boy memorial; Alice loses Reanne's rear-based holiday horror; Uzzi corrects Ciaran's typo; Sketch flushes James's toilet tattoo away.

programme.title: Tattoo Fixers: Extreme
programme.desc: Pash performs a clean-up for pole dancer Joe; Sketch sees to Holli's belly-button buddy; Uzzi creates a magical tattoo for Gary, the son of Paul Daniels.

programme.title: Tattoo Fixers: Extreme
programme.desc: Pash mops up a ghastly gravy gaffe; Sketch chases away a confusing chicken tattoo; Alice gives Danni an inspirational design; Uzzi deletes a DIY disaster.

programme.title: Tattoo Fixers: Extreme
programme.desc: Alice works up a sweat as she tackles Emily's foot tattoo; Uzzi cures Adam's silly statement; Sketch has a close encounter with Tony; Pash draws a line under Jamie's risqué rhyme.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's first programme is Ruby Tates in Brighton, owned and run by ex-actor and failed Hollywood wannabe ALLAN LOVE. Situated in an affluent and trendy area just one street back from the beach, it's an oyster bar and seafood restaurant but Allan's never tasted the food because he hates fish.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's programme is The Priory, a 100-seater carvery in Haywards Heath, Sussex owned by ex IT consultant Scott. The former chapel of a nineteenth-century convent, the restaurant is in a spectacularly beautiful location and offers bargain roast dinners from a carvery that's been running for twenty years. Scott bought the place for £300k but with an ageing clientele eating for half-price, he's losing £5,000 a week.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is Piccolo Teatro, a bijou vegetarian restaurant in Paris run by feisty Scot Rachel. A former waitress at the restaurant, Rachel bought it three years ago and now, along with best friend Stephanie, she's trying to convert the carnivorous French into a nation of veggies. For Gordon it's a sentimental journey to the city where he spent his formative years as a chef, a food mecca full of gastronomic delights that should be a dream.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's penultimate programme is The Curry Lounge in Nottingham, the city with more restaurants per square mile than any other in Britain. This 120-seater Indian restaurant has been run since January by ex sales director Raz who's new to the business - and it shows. Despite a ~500k refurbishment and décor like a Bollywood set the honeymoon period's well and truly over. His once-healthy trade is evaporating and at his current rate of loss it's uncertain he'll make it past Christmas.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits a “Caribbean” style resort hotel in Fort Pierce, Florida where the young inexperienced owner, Brian is making guests’ time at the hotel miserable with filthy rooms, late night concerts and shocking service.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits Island Park, Idaho to try and rescue the failing Angler’s Lodge. Despite building the stunning lodge with his own hands, owner Dave Ebey has lost his passion and it has almost cost him his business.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits Harper’s Ferry in West Virginia, to try to save a historic hotel that’s desperately in need of help. Karan Townsend, the owner, runs the hotel like a thrift store and hoards junk everywhere.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon continues his mission to fix the failing Town’s Inn in Harper’s Ferry, West Virginia despite having to shut down the hotel after witnessing some shocking food practices. These are some of the worst Ramsay has encountered.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: The Vienna owner’s Jonathan and Lisa Krach are at their breaking point and have become trapped in their Austrian themed hotel, drowning in debt. Gordon discovers some shocking rumors about the owners and the real reason customers have stopped coming.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits Newtown in Pennsylvania, to try and save a historic hotel that is desperately in need of help. Verindar, the owner, runs the hotel like an angry tyrant. Her staff is ready to quit because they are so unhappy with the way they are treated.

programme.title: The Cops
programme.desc: A lone police officer is violently set upon when he gets called out to two strangers sitting in a woman's parked car on her drive; emergency services have to move swiftly after they find a house doused in petrol and a man threatening to set it.

programme.title: The Cops
programme.desc: The Squad come face to face with an axe man who's smashed in his neighbor's door, an officer is injured as they try to restrain him and the cops have to use CS gas; a student is arrested after assaulting staff in a pub where he worked.

programme.title: The Cops
programme.desc: Firearms officers and a dog unit race to an address in Nottingham where a man is reported to be blockading his family in a house and threatening to kill them, and a manhunt ensues; bodycam cops chase a car that fails to stop.

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: Flying doctor Sarah fights to save the life of a pensioner knocked down near her home by anaesthetizing her in the middle of a suburban street.

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: The team race to rescue a biker thrown 30 metres into a road-sign after he slips into a diabetic coma in the saddle.

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: Both choppers are called to a head-on road smash in the Yorkshire Dales that’s left two pensioners trapped in their wrecked car. Ex Royal Marine pilot Harry swoops on a street in Castleford to drop his medics next to an unconscious cyclist feared to have a brain injury. Paramedics Sammy and Ady find themselves dealing with a difficult patient who insists he wants to climb back on his badly damaged motorbike thanks to bizarre effects of a head injury sustained in the accident. Flying doctor Jez is confronted by a baffling whodunnit after a man is accidentally shot at a firing range. A jockey thrown by his galloping horse amazes the team with his toughness as he undergoes treatment on a broken bone without even flinching. Meanwhile, a crash outside one of Yorkshire’s most famous stately homes leaves a man with a chronic medical condition trapped in his upturned car. On the moors, paramedics Pete and Lee rescue an off road biker injured when his motorcycle toppled off a rock.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's first programme is La Lanterna in Letchworth, Hertfordshire. Twenty-eight-year-old owner and head chef Alex offers modern Italian cuisine, a taste of Little Italy in England's first garden city, and the restaurant is run by his best mate maitre dé Gavin, helped by his ex-air hostess girlfriend Emily. But Alex has no customers, cookers that don't work and an expensive menu that's about as authentically Italian as a spag bol.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is D-Place in Chelmsford, Essex run by Mexican-born Israel and his English partner Tara. They've sunk ~£150,000 of their own money into their trendy café bar which offers a vast selection of fusion cuisine. In charge is Executive Chef Philippe, producing everything from all-day breakfasts to hoi sin noodles with an astounding lack of flair; the plastic food is dire and boomerangs back from the dining room as soon as it's cooked.
